Its mechanism involves inhibiting the synthesis of mevalonate, a precursor to cholesterol, leading to reduced cholesterol production and an increase in the liver's LDL receptors.
Cholecap's primary action involves targeting the HMG-CoA reductase enzyme, resulting in decreased cholesterol synthesis and increased removal of LDL cholesterol from the blood.
